name: Bureau du Tibet
bossPosition: Representative of H.H. the Dalai Lama
goal:
- to monitor and report on human rights, environmental and socio economic conditions of the Tibetans inside Tibet and keep the governments, Parliaments and NGOs informed of the recent developments in Tibet.

- to serve as a liaison office and source of information on matters relating to Tibetans inside and outside Tibet, including history, culture, religion, environment and all aspects of the Tibetan way of life.

- to maintain direct contact with governments, Parliaments, non-governmental organisations and human rights groups.


The Bureau du Tibet established in 2001in Brussels is the official agency of His Holiness the Dalai Lama and the Central Tibetan Administration-in-Exile based in Dharamsala, India.
interests: Environment, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development
euInitiatives: EU's common policy on Human Rights in the world and particularly in China
